title: Student Nurse Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview with recruiter, 2nd interview with nurse manager. Behavioral and slight situational questions.  All on zoom, offered position at 2nd interview. Very nice recruiter and nurse manager and loves GMBC overall.
Interview Questions: Name a situation that you had when dealing with a customer at your past job.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: I heard at least three different things from three different managers, very disorganized. Miscommunication is a big problem and you’re expected to know things without them telling you, not willing to work with you.
Interview Questions: They asked if I had applied to other hospital organizations

title: HR-Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was one of the final candidates but nobody ever called to tell me that the job was offered to someone else.  When I finally went to them and learned that I had not been selected, I was also told that the recruiter had left me a message on my cell phone!  That's like breaking up in an email - or maybe worse.  I never got any sort of voice mail message from GBMC and a part of me is glad because that is totally unprofessional conduct.
Interview Questions: They asked me how I would handle a variety of leadership issues.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
3 part interview, group interview 
Got back to me same day 
ICU
Good experience 
Applied as a new grad, HR is very organized and on top of things 
Had 2 phone interviews and 1 FaceTime interview
Interview Questions:
Experience 
Why you chose this position

title: Patient Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I went two times in person to do interview with Manager, I went two times in person to do interview with Manager , I went two times in person to do interview with Manager.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Long and tedious.  Asked strange questions. Very little about philosophy of patient care. They seemed more interested in asking hypothetical questions.  It seemed more as if they wanted to see if you were able to give rote answers.  I was not impressed at all.  I found some questions were not relevant to my job or profession.
Interview Questions: Do you know what a non profit versus a for profit hospital means?  Of course I do.  Why is that important for a nursing position.  I will not treat a patient any differently.

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Normal for higher level engineer. 1 or 2 phone screenings to verify you know what you say you do on resume. Then an interview with manager and final panel interview with director, manager, and senior level engineer. It did take about 2 months before I got offer after final interview, not first time that's happened but I had honestly thought I didnt get position it took so long. I was happy when I did get the call.
Interview Questions: Normal what would do, how you handle questions. Not super technical until last interview where senior engineer was present. Nothing too difficult but you had to know what you were talking about. To put it bluntly, you couldn't have BS your way through technical questions. As long as you actually know what you put on your resume them nothing to fear.

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD)
Interview Descriptions: First you meet with a nursing recruiter in Human Resources. Then, you are taken to the department where you meet with a Clinical Coordinator and the Nurse Manager. After the Clinical Coordinator asks questions, you have a 1:1 interview with the Nurse Manager.
Interview Questions: I didn't get asked difficult questions, but some questions were: "What do you find the most challenging about working in the ER?" "Tell me about a situation where a patient was very upset with you and how you handled it." "Tell me about a scenario where you had integrity."

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process isn't too stringent.  They are mostly looking to see that your are a thoughtful person that can handle responsibilities at the hospital.

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were too many people (unnecessary) in the interview. There were a total of four people and only one person spoke; which was the same person who was conducting the interview

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had two days of orientation and I spoke very well during the interview.I was explained the process of the job as far as what they accept and what the do not tolerate.I was given a toar of the hospital,introduced to some of the employees,and most the manager treated me with the up most of respect.
Interview Questions: how well do you get along with other people

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Meet with HR - manager - department associates in a conference room- they ask questions personal and business- kind if a ice breaker .  and  then I had a three day have orientation before the actual work week
Interview Questions: What is your favorite pass time hobby

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is different for every position. It also depends if you are an existing employee or not. My interview process was an average one. I was well prepared and the hiring managers were easy to talk to.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: one interview. basic questions about experience.    again it was very simple and basic interview.  just study any general interview questions and dont be an idiot/ jerk.  tell them you loe collecting co-pays because they loooove taking peoples copays as soon as posible.  good luck to you all. no college degree requiered.  just make sure you like asking sick people for their money.
Interview Questions: tell us about your past experience.

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was promoted to this position 5 years ago. The hiring process for managers have typically been within the organization and you must know someone (so to speak) to advance.
Interview Questions: Do you have a degree? You are doing the work but without a degree you can not advance...

title: Ccu Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview and an inperson interview with the unit manager.  The interview with the unit manager was preceeded with a share day with another nurse on the unit.  This is typical of interviews in the nursing field.  I was made an offer while I was driving home from the interview and I accepted the offer after requesting and reviewing information about GBMC that was sent to me from HR via e-mail.  Everyone was pleasant and the experience was quite smooth.

title: Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GBMC HealthCare (Towson, MD) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was with a director and senior vice present. The interview was relatively informal and conversational with no curveball questions. They also asked about my strengths and what I would bring to the team.  They also asked questions about my resume and my future goals. I had a few follow up phone calls afterwards with another person in the department.
Interview Questions: What would you bring to the team?
